comments.commentBody: The Republicans want to keep him in office at least until he signs their tax cuts. He has already given them the gutting of the EPA and a relaxation of emission standards, but we know they are a greedy bunch and want more.

If the US seriously wants China to help meaningfully (i.e., to help us impose reunification of the Koreas under the South's political system) we need a deal where we assure China that we will (1) assist in dealing with the refugee crisis that will ensue in the aftermath of what is likely to be a chaotic reunification process, and (2) terminate our defense treaty with the South and withdraw our troops post-reunification, allowing the South to become non-aligned.

China craves border security above all else, and they don't trust that our military presence in South Korea is not a pretext to launch an offensive on China via the Korean peninsula. On the other hand, China and South Korea enjoy a friendly relationship, and without a threat from North Korea, the South would probably be very happy to stay non-aligned between the US and China. China would in turn gain an economically (if not politically) stable neighbor that was still not allied with the US.

In short, if you remove North Korea as a basis for needing a large US military presence in the South, our troops can come home, China gets a peaceful neighbor, and you remove a major nuclear threat from the world. Trump is The Great Dealmaker, and he is also looking for ways to reduce expenditures on alliances while increasing US security. So let's start thinking outside of the box we have been trapped in for the past 60+ years and make a deal, already.
If you're so smart, why aren't you president?
The one major flaw and unknowable in that scenario is which of the many "Trumps" shows up on a given day. The wrong trump on the wrong day could have disastrous consequences.

Trump is no deal maker, great or otherwise.  Usually he studiously avoids any knowledge of the deals made in his name to maintain his "plausible deniability" in the nearly inevitable lawsuits to come.

I just wonder how many Democrats had contact with the Russians over the years? Russia is after all a major nuclear power and a big player on the world stage. Still no smoking gun an election interference.

I'm beginning to think it is the Pentagon and the State Department that has a vested interest in keeping the Cold War going. A "threat" that gets you big budgets with little chance of actual fighting. Unlike their ten years of unwinnable wars in the Middle East.

They certainly are hysterical about Trump contemplating a reset in our policy - up to and including leaking secrets to discredit Trump. Is the real power in our country the Pentagon with its oversized public relations department and ability to embarrass presidents.

"Rabbi Lazar, who has condemned critics of Mr. Putin’s actions in Ukraine..."

Really?

This troubles this Jew (me).
This increased scrutiny of Team Trump, is responsible for his barrage of tweets this morning, concerning alleged wiretaps by Obama
Fair enough - but has a foreign country ever affected OUR elections before?
Admittedly, it's unfortunate that Donald is in control.  Timing is everything.

Aside from innuendo, hyperbole and political rhetoric, does The Times have any concrete evidence that a crime was committed?  Sorry to disappoint you folks.  But it's no crime to have friends who are former Russian interpreters and Russian diplomats.  But which laws were broken?  If my friend hates my enemies and decides to attack them it isn't a crime.  Do you have any concrete evidence that Trump or his team instructed Russia to make these cyber attacks?  If not, try to create a better story. What you have presented in this article reads like a third-rate Grisham novel.
Let's start with perjury by Sessions and go from there.

It's a bit too much to endure Trump's xenphobia stekes with a side of Russian slaw. I was raised to suspect Russians, sorry. They actually send folks here to simmer for years until they can damage our democracy from the inside.

Who's this Rabbi? Does he know where I can get a few chairs, like 12 of them?

If Trump is confident that he and his political surrogates did not collaborate with Russia to affect our election, he should be the first one demanding a thorough and impartial investigation to clear this up.

With Trump calling it a "total witch hunt" and with Republican leaders refusing to support an objective investigation, they are just raising more suspicion and guaranteeing that this will drag on for months.

Really if it was nothing why was it done in secret? The one coming up about the Dems currently have all been done with knowledge and in public and with the press. The other is not and the lied about it until confronted.
Why do you have a problem with the Russians sending representives to the RNC convention?  They needed to look after their investment, after all.

So we think that Sessions, from Alabama is a good role model? Is Alabama a well run state that thrives with a reputation of fairness and justice for all? I think not, and poor Alabama along with Mississippi are usually in the bottom two rungs in the USA. What did Sessions accomplish in his home state? He is unqualified and needs to be removed from this important position asap.

A female [former?] conservative member of British Parliament appeared on one or more of the cable news channels this week.  Without hesitation, she quickly identified Sessions's offense as "perjury," and prescribed recusal, resignation, and jail time.

What I just can't figure out is what the heck was the Russian Ambassador doing at the Republican National Convention in the first place.  Was he invited?  Was he a guest speaker?  Was he a delegate?  Or was he there to oversee his boss's handiwork?

You can say that again.

No wonder commrade trumpsky hates SNL so much.

Oh but I think I read ( saw, heard, made up a story) that the Russian Ambassador was on vacation in Cleveland at the time...so it's a coincidence, of course.  He just wanted to visit the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.

Thanks for the chuckle, Gail.  But mostly, Thanks for being the ONE person in the media who, in the moments and days following The Idiot's address to congress, has not said he seemed "presidential."  Can we all agree that nothing -- nothing -- this loathsome creature ever does could ever -- by the most tortured definition of the word -- be or seem "presidential."  I have three dogs, and in the midst of their bowel movements they not only seem - but are - more 'presidential.'  Indeed, the output of their bowel movements is more presidential than He Who Must Not Be Named will ever be.

Hey, we have a president who bragged publicly during a debate that he is smart enough NOT to pay taxes!
So now we have an SG who lies under oath.

Where do we go from here?

I listened to a Right Wing Colonel (Retired) tell a locker room crowd that our only important allies were Russia and India, particularly Russia. "They are the only other Caucasian people fighting ISIS".  So there's that.
What to do about Chuck Grassley?
Immoral and dishonest.                                       He needs to leave, already.

Jeff Sessions' creditability as the head of the Department of Justice has been completely undermined by his inability to understand that his untruthful testimony--written and oral--are disqualifying. Justice may be blind, but she's neither deaf nor dumb.
Excellent!
You forgot the part about the guy in Cleveland publicly asking the Russians to hack their opponents accounts.  It was all out in the open...just seemingly beyond anyone's control.
I'm sorry, but on what planet was Sessions' answer truthful?
